trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of parameters associated with a <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand"></xref> and their respective mappings to columns in a <xref href="System.Data.DataSet"></xref>.
This class cannot be inherited.

If the command contains an ad hoc SQL statement, as opposed to a stored-procedure name, the number of the parameters in the collection must be equal to the number of parameter placeholders within the command text, or SQL Server raises an error.
With a stored procedure, all the parameters declared in the stored procedure without a default value must be provided.
Parameters declared with a default value are optional.
This lets you specify a value other than the default.
For more information with additional sample code demonstrating how to use parameters, see [Commands and Parameters](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/commands-and-parameters.md).
Adds the specified <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> object to the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> to add to the collection.
A new <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> object.
The specified in the value parameter is already added to this or another .
The parameter passed was not a <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref>.
The value parameter is null.
Adds the specified <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> object to the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
The index of the new <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> object.
Adds a <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> to the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref> given the parameter name and the data type.
The name of the parameter.
One of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlDbType"></xref> values.
A new <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> object.
Adds the specified <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> object to the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref>.
The name of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> to add to the collection.
A <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
A new <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> object.
Use caution when you are using this overload of the `SqlParameterCollection.Add` method to specify integer parameter values.
Because this overload takes a value of type , you must convert the integral value to an type when the value is zero, as the following C# example demonstrates.
If you do not perform this conversion, the compiler assumes that you are trying to call the `SqlParameterCollection.Add` (`string`, `SqlDbType`) overload.
The specified in the value parameter is already added to this or another .
The value parameter is null.

Adds a <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> to the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref>, given the specified parameter name, <xref href="System.Data.SqlDbType"></xref> and size.
This overload is useful when you are adding a parameter of a variable-length data type such as `varchar` or `binary`.
The name of the parameter.
The <xref href="System.Data.SqlDbType"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> to add to the collection.
The size as an <xref href="System.Int32"></xref>.
A new <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> object.
Adds a <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> to the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref> with the parameter name, the data type, and the column length.
The name of the parameter.
One of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlDbType"></xref> values.
The column length.

The name of the source column (<xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter.SourceColumn"></xref>) if this <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> is used in a call to <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbDataAdapter.Update*"></xref>.
A new <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> object.
Adds an array of values to the end of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Array"></xref> values to add.
Adds an array of <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> values to the end of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> values to add.
Adds a value to the end of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref>.
<xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection.AddWithValue%2A> replaces the `SqlParameterCollection.Add` method that takes a <xref:System.String> and an <xref:System.Object>.

The overload of `Add` that takes a string and an object was deprecated because of possible ambiguity with the `SqlParameterCollection.Add` overload that takes a <xref:System.String> and a <xref:System.Data.SqlDbType> enumeration value where passing an integer with the string could be interpreted as being either the parameter value or the corresponding <xref:System.Data.SqlDbType> value.
Use <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection.AddWithValue%2A> whenever you want to add a parameter by specifying its name and value.
For <xref:System.Data.SqlDbType>`Xml` enumeration values, you can use a string, an XML value, an <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> derived type instance, or a <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlXml> object.
The name of the parameter.
The value to be added.
Use <xref href="System.DBNull.Value"></xref> instead of null, to indicate a null value.
A <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> object.
Removes all the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> objects from the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref>.
Determines whether the specified <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> is in this <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> value.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref> contains the value; otherwise `false`.
Determines whether the specified <xref href="System.Object"></xref> is in this <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> value.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref> contains the value; otherwise `false`.
Determines whether the specified parameter name is in this <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> value.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref> contains the value; otherwise `false`.

Copies all the elements of the current <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref> to the specified one-dimensional <xref href="System.Array"></xref> starting at the specified destination <xref href="System.Array"></xref> index.
The one-dimensional <xref href="System.Array"></xref> that is the destination of the elements copied from the current <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref>.
A 32-bit integer that represents the index in the <xref href="System.Array"></xref> at which copying starts.

Copies all the elements of the current <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref> to the specified <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref> starting at the specified destination index.

The <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref> that is the destination of the elements copied from the current <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref>.
A 32-bit integer that represents the index in the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref> at which copying starts.
Returns an Integer that contains the number of elements in the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref>.
Read-only.
The number of elements in the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref> as an Integer.
Returns an enumerator that iterates through the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref>.
Gets the location of the specified <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> within the collection.
The <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> to find.
The zero-based location of the specified <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> that is a <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> within the collection.
Returns -1 when the object does not exist in the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref>.
Gets the location of the specified <xref href="System.Object"></xref> within the collection.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to find.
The zero-based location of the specified <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that is a <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> within the collection.
Returns -1 when the object does not exist in the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref>.
Gets the location of the specified <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> with the specified name.
The case-sensitive name of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> to find.
The zero-based location of the specified <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> with the specified case-sensitive name.
Returns -1 when the object does not exist in the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref>.
Inserts a <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> object into the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref> at the specified index.
The zero-based index at which value should be inserted.
A <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> object to be inserted in the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref>.
Inserts an <xref href="System.Object"></xref> into the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref> at the specified index.
The zero-based index at which value should be inserted.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to be inserted in the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref> has a fixed size.
Returns `true` if the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref> has a fixed size; otherwise `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref> is read-only.
Returns `true` if the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref> is read only; otherwise `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref> is synchronized.
Returns `true` if the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref> is synchronized; otherwise `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> with the specified name.
The `parameterName` is used to look up the index value in the underlying <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection>.
If the `parameterName` is not valid, an <xref:System.IndexOutOfRangeException> will be thrown.
The name of the parameter to retrieve.
The <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> with the specified name.
The specified parameterName is not valid.
Gets the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> at the specified index.
The zero-based index of the parameter to retrieve.
The <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> at the specified index.
The specified index does not exist.
Removes the specified <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> from the collection.
A <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> object to remove from the collection.
The parameter is not a <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref>.
The parameter does not exist in the collection.
Removes the specified <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> from the collection.
The object to remove from the collection.
Removes the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> from the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref> at the specified index.
The zero-based index of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> object to remove.
Removes the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> from the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref> at the specified parameter name.
The name of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter"></xref> to remove.
Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref>.
An object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameterCollection"></xref>.
